Description: Ostracon, section (two fragments joined) of the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel with flaring sides, the fabric is partially grey in section, interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a brown-coloured slip and remains nine lines of Coptic text written in black ink, worn in parts, and containing a list of names.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.131)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36337) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36337)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 160 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
Miscellaneous number: SB XVIII 13383 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
